name: Bubby's
address: 120 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text: pancakes were okay, but overhyped and too pricey for what it is. waiter got upset and started being sarcastic for us not tipping, as if heâ€™s not getting paid from the restaurant already please come on
Very delicious, a little expensive for breakfast. Service could be a bit more attentive.

Terrible experience and poor service. We waited for over an hour, and my friend waited for almost two hours. If the restaurant only prioritizes reservations, they should just say theyâ€™re fully booked instead of letting people stand there waiting forever.

When it was finally supposed to be our turn, the staff kept pressuring us to sit outside, even though we had already waited so long. One server told us, â€œYouâ€™re next,â€ but then said, â€œOh, a reservation just arrived,â€ and pushed us back again. Completely unprofessional and disrespectful.

And after all that waiting, the food was so disappointing. We thought it would be really good, but it was way below expectations â€” the fries tasted like leftovers, and the pancakes felt like something homemade, not restaurant quality at all.

Overall, disorganized system, poor service, and underwhelming food. Definitely not worth the wait or the hype.

The hostess Lena was incredibly kind and very efficient. The line for a table was long, and yet she was able to get our party seated quickly. Our server Alex was also wonderful. She was nice and very attentive. The food was great, as always! Highly highly recommend Bubbyâ€™s for anyone who may be visiting the city. Thank you guys for a wonderful experience.

Hmm, we were hoping for a really amazing experience and the atmosphere and staff were great, the food selection was a bit more eclectic than expected. We thought the pancakes would be light and fluffy, sadly they were heavy and a little tough ğŸ˜” I mentioned to the wait staff that I don't normally like home style fries unless they are crispy, they said their crispy is charred but soft inside, I said that's perfect. What I received was a mushy mix of soggy potatoes and onions.. unappetizing. The saving grace were the eggs,and the biscuits. We ordered both scrambled and overeasy, both were done perfectly in my opinion. And the biscuits .. wow .. I could have had those with the eggs and the pork sausage (or bacon) and that would have been a wonderful combo. Would we come again? Maybe. There are soo many other options, probably not.
Power tripping line manager needs to learn some people skills. Everything else was amazing.

Party of 2, we waited about 25 min on a Sunday just past noon time. The food was good, especially the pancake flight, and filled us up for pretty much the whole day.

It is very very loud inside, so it is a little difficult to chat. Overall, yeah it was worth the wait if you're not in a rush.
What a fun breakfast spot in Tribeca. Great food with a VERY efficient staff. Everything was cooked to perfect and well worth the wait!

Over the years, Bubby's has become one of our favourite spots to stop by for breakfast. At the start of October, my partner and I decided that it would be the perfect spot to take our family there on our wedding day to fuel up and have our first brunch as a married couple!

The staff were absolutely incredible as always from the moment we walked in, to the us finishing up. Service was super quick and efficient, especially given there were 13 of us in total.

All our family were so complimentary on everything and we all managed to leave personalised notes on the wall, which was a lovely touch. We can't wait to come back again!
Very HYPE place. The waitress at dinner was not friendly at all. The â€œVEGANâ€ burger contains egg. Asking for the check several times. Thereâ€™s other places more worth it and authentic around.

Food was good, and a buzzy wee vibe! They have a photobooth too if you want to capture the moment. Definitely a busy spot, so either book or be prepared to wait for a table. Turn around is quick though!

Tables are snug, but one you are in there is plenty of space to enjoy your meal and have a chat.
The burger is very good, and the pies are absolutely delicious. The seasonal pumpkin pie with caramelized pecans is definitely worth a try, and the apple pie never disappoints!
Crowded, overpriced, nothing special! Went based off of reviews and totally regret. Wouldnâ€™t recommend try elsewhere
Expensive for what it is and no espresso based coffee drinks available
Not a very creative menu, extremely basic everything pre-prepared it felt like they just make the eggs and heat everything else up, dry pancakes , was not a fan
Best biscuits and gravy Iâ€™ve had!
Zero taste + unfriendly staff + unnecessarily expensive. Not worth waiting in line.
Reserve in advance! Not a local and was shocked to see how long the line was outside when we showed up for our reservation on Monday for brunch.
Food was lovely and portions are really big, I do recommend you book a table before coming as it can get really busy and do come hungry if you want to finish your plate. Sausages taste amazing !
Very quick! Its a popular spot that often has a line but it moves fast. The biscuits are great and so are the pancakes.

Had a delicious breakfast here, so glad I came!
Visited around 8am on a Tuesday - was able to sit at the bar. Service was great, very friendly and responsive.

I got the Hibiscus Iced Tea - server gave me extra simple syrup on the side if I wanted it sweeter.
The Chicken and Pancakes were PHENOMENAL. The chicken was piping hot and crispy, perfectly seasoned and a generous portion. The pancakes were thick but still light. The butter and syrup provided allowed me to customise to my preference.
I broke up the rosemary stick over the pancakes and omg I am totally putting rosemary on my pancakes from now on, it was next level delicious.

The vibes are great, the staff are all friendly and smiley and the food is perfection. 10/10.

went to Bubbyâ€™s for breakfast, and although it was packed with about a 45-minute wait, it was absolutely worth it. The atmosphere was lively and cozy, the kind of bustling New York breakfast spot that makes you feel like youâ€™re part of something special.
I ordered the homemade home fries, which came Southern-style with sautÃ©ed onions and peppers. They were perfectly seasoned and had that crispy, golden edge thatâ€™s hard to get just right.
The highlight, though, was the fried chicken and pancakes served with bourbon maple syrup. The pancakes were fluffy and rich, with a twist, thereâ€™s sour cream in the batter, which gives them a subtle tang and an extra tender texture. Itâ€™s a small detail that makes a big difference.
I also sampled the cheese grits, and they were creamy, comforting, and full of flavor, a perfect side to round out the meal.
Overall, Bubbyâ€™s delivered a fantastic Southern-inspired breakfast experience right in the heart of NYC. If you donâ€™t mind the wait, itâ€™s a must visit spot for a hearty and memorable brunch.
Biscuits were amazing! Overall, great spot for brunch. There was quite a wait but it went by pretty quickly, especially for a Sunday.
Very rude staff tbh and influencer types get treated much more kindly than regular people. Food is great though if youâ€™re willing to sacrifice on service
Drove in from LI. Food was awesome!

The potatoes were good and the pancakes too. Grit i donâ€™t know what itâ€™s supposed to be but the texture was like vomit. Overall pricey and i was disappointed that the tip was already set up and the waiter did not tell us that and just told us to sign and press continue. So beware of that, it felt scam-ish to me and there was a lot of sun on the terminalâ€™s screen so i could not see well. I did not want to pay a 8$ tip on a 27$ bill that 29% thatâ€™s ridiculous and the service was not great. Coffee is undrinkable

Looked forward to eating here on my NYC visit. It was very crowded but we were sat quickly as it was only 2 of us. The service was friendly and quick for how busy they were. The food was another story. Overrated sums it up. The pancakes described as fluffy were not at all. I do not know what they use to make their pancakes but my guess is they used too much baking soda as they were dense and had a notably odd taste. The coffee was also odd tasting and I could only drink a few sips. The best item was their cream on the pancakes. It was light and delicious and the only thing that was completely eaten.
HUGE PORTIONS you should consider people that come on their own can't have anything really...try  a for one menu with options! God food otherwise!
sÃºper caroğŸ™„
Yeah, Bubby's was the whole package!  That pancake...it was so good I have no words.
Chicken and Pancakes were so good and flavorful.

The manager was extremely hostile with us because we got up to go pay since we asked for the bill so may times and no one got it for us, so we tried to go to the cashier and pay and the manager yelled from across the restaurant to us to â€œsit downâ€ apparently they dont have apple pay that day but we were not told. Horrible experience. Horrible attitude.
Leurs pancakes sont sÃ»rement les meilleurs que jâ€™ai goÃ»tÃ© jusquâ€™Ã  lÃ

Good foodâ€¦

The stuffed French toast which was the week special was differentâ€¦ The potatoes were also exceptional!

The 45 minute wait in line was crazinessâ€¦ Depends on how much you crave this.

Service was quick and efficientâ€¦ Minnie was extensive.
We went on a rainy day in October so outdoor seating was limitedâ€¦

Only recommendation is to go early if you donâ€™t want to wait in crazy long lines
Be ready to wait in a long line.  We did go on a Saturday for brunch,  so it was about an hour wait. But the food was worth it!
Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø§Ù† ÙƒÙŠÙƒ Ø§Ø³Ø·ÙˆØ±ÙŠ

There was a line to get in early on a Sunday morning when they opened. I think it was typical of most breakfast/brunch you can get in the city. Pretty solid overall. Our experience was a little interrupted by a very rude older woman sitting in the first table of the patio trying to tell everyone what to do, although she didn't work for the restaurant.
Not worth waiting 45 min + for table and food gives very high calorie and zero taste

Durant notre voyage Ã  New York on a eu le plaisir de faire un brunch chez Bubbyâ€™s, on a adorÃ©, endroit trÃ¨s convivial, service rapide, les pancakes sont excellents moelleux Ã  souhaitâ€¦. Nyc me manques tellement

Horrible food looked good but I saw a rat running around the place which made me not want to eat the food will never come back here and once I told whoever served me the issue they were rude about it acting like I was lying donâ€™t recommend

I got the pancake flight and the Bubby's breakfast. I thought it was okay. The wait staff were nice and there was a bit of a line even at 8 AM on a Wednesday. Thankfully we had a reservation so we were seated almost immediately. The pancakes were a bit disappointing. The flavor on them was good but the actual pancakes themselves were super thick and doughy (not my personal taste). With the Bubby's breakfast, the eggs were severely under seasoned, the toast was burnt and only toasted on one side. The potatoes and the bacon were good though. It was decently expensive for breakfast food especially, and I wouldn't go back.

Nach einiger Wartezeit ohne Reservierung 2 PlÃ¤tze an der Bar bekommen und dort vom sehr netten Barkeeper ein leckeres FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck serviert bekommen. Zur Erinnerung haben wir die Bubbys Kaffeetasse erworben.
$29 for pancakes that tasted like dry old cake, you could make better ones with a walmart mix. Definitely not worth the hype.

My sister and I had pancakes here today, and honestly, it was the WORST pancake Iâ€™ve ever had in my life. It didnâ€™t taste fresh, wasnâ€™t fluffy, and had a slightly burnt flavor. Paying $29 for a pancake plate was honestly ridiculous. On top of that, the staff were pretty passive-aggressive. Weâ€™d only been sitting there for maybe 30 minutes when someone came over to ask if we wanted anything else â€” when we said no, they immediately brought the bill and said, â€œOkay, then here you go.â€ The place itself looks nice, but the food was so bad that Iâ€™d never go back. Please donâ€™t waste your money here.

Great spot with tasty food. Popular, need to queue
The best breakfast in New York. Great location, great food, generous serving size. And great coffee. A wonderful way to start your day.
I had a relaxed couple of beers with some friendly chat with a great barman. Brilliant.
Good but nothing special - paying $33 (after tip and tax) for some normal pancakes is diabolical

This place is famous for its pancakes, but can pancakes that leave a taste of flour on the tip of your tongue be said to be delicious?  Also, the fishy taste of butter, rather than the flavor of butter, envelops the tip of the nose.  Even though I had a cold, it smelled fishy.  Without the berries and sauce as toppings, it would have been difficult to eat an entire pancake.  The berry sauce wasn't enough, so I had the rest of the pancakes left over.  The chicken came with fried breast meat along with the legs, and I was satisfied as it was reasonably soft and not dry.  The biscuits provided on the side were buttery, light, and tasted better than I expected!  There was no special service or friendliness from the server during the meal, but when the waiter handed over the bill, the waiter dialed 22% in advance and said to me, â€œAll you just  sign please here!â€  I was so embarrassed that I checked and found that the receipt he gave me was 22% of the price, including tax.  These days, there seem to be a lot of restaurants in New York that include tax and calculate tips on receipts, so it's essential to check!

We arrived on a regular weekday and around 10 am for brunch!  There was no way and we were able to go in immediately.  From the start to end the staff were all very friendly and nice!

I highly recommend getting the home fries instead of the regular fries!

Since we wanted to try as many as possible we ended up ordering a little bit more than we should have ğŸ˜… but we didn't quite know the portion of each dish so maybe that's something the staff could advise on do not have any food wasted!  But again overall the staff were very nice.

Each of the dishes were very delicious and would come back if I lived around the area!  I hope that there's a choice to order just one pancake instead of the whole thing ğŸ˜€

You cannot bring in your stroller so you have to leave it outside which was okay but a bit scary considering it could be stolen...

Love Bubbyâ€™s and waiting lines are not as bad as it seems.

Must have the Nutella and berry jamâ€™s pancakes. Huge, definitely for, at least, 3 people sharing.
I usually split a salted and a sweet dish in 2 but pancakes are huge. Should go with plenty space for that brunch!

Fries are really good too. Not the house ones tho

Tried the James Beard pancakes, specifically the Pancake Flight. This consists of three different toppings. If you are not a huge fan of sweet, then forgo this. These pancakes were thick, but so light and fluffy. Would definitely go back for this alone. The other two dishes were the Cheese Grits Breakfast and Bubby's Breakfast. Nothing notable, but the cheese grits were good. Pro tip, I went for Sunday brunch and the line was LONG but the three of us opted to sit at the bar. Waited only 10 minutes and the service was excellent. It was also interesting to watch the bartenders in action during peak capacity.

A rare perfect breakfast! I really enjoyed the huevos rancheros, and two of my friends said that the biscuits in their biscuits and gravy were literally the best biscuits they had eaten. We split the pancakes with toppings and thought they were amazing, although all three of us felt glad that we hadn't ordered it as our main dish since they were so filling. We hit several already-researched restaurants on our short trip to NYC and this was definitely one of the highlights!

Reserve ahead of time! The lines get crazy so you may want to skip them.

The service was the best here, very friendly and accommodating staff, however the food was okeyâ€¦ people say they have the best pancakes but honestly they seemed overloaded with toppings and nothing out of this world.

Food comes out veeeeeery fast so definitely a plus.

The siting for two people is uncomfortable, it is directly in the air conditioning blast and the tables are very near to each other so it is difficult to get in and out.

Da provare. Tra i migliori pancakes a New York City. Un poâ€™ di attesa (circa 25-30 minuti) trattandosi di una domenica mattina. Porzioni molto abbondanti. Volendo si possono dividere in due persone affiancando ai pancakes una opzione salata. Prezzo in linea con gli standard locali

Such a treat for brunch in New York! Bubby's was wonderful! Food was phenomenal and large portions for the price were a plus. Pancake flight was fluffy and fresh, especially the berries and nutella. Their mugs and merchandise make the cutest little souvenir to bring back home. And the photo booth is a cherry on top. Would return 100% if I go back!

Bel locale dove fare una vera colazione americana....pancakes molto buoni (anche GLUTEN FREE!!! - attenzione  a possibili contaminazioni, non hanno una cucina separata) e soprattutto porzioni abbondanti (prezzo in linea con le porzioni!) molto affollato e abbastanza rumoroso nelle ore di punta. Il locale e molto grande ed accoglie molte persone.

The Flannel Hash was surprisingly good, but the Bacon Mac N Cheese went above and beyond in terms of flavor. We also had the Pancake Flight and they were pretty great pancakes with some nice grass-fed butter to put on them as well.

My group was able to be immediately sat down inside but would have had to wait for a table outside. It was very loud and hard to talk.

Place is cute! We ordered the veggie omelette and Nutella pancakes with berry compote on the side. Both were delicious but weâ€™d probably be back for just the pancakes. They were definitely the star of the show which made their price seem worth it.

This place has fantastic food, great service and good vibes. The pancake flight was amazing. The caramelized banana pancake was my favorite of the three. I went on a Friday morning and there was no wait with plenty of seating at the bar. Definitely coming back here.

Great atmosphere and worth the wait. The pancakes are what everyone talks about and yes they are great but don't sleep on their savory dishes. Had the soft shell crab sandwich and it was filling made just right and so flavorful. The pancakes come with many different options like chocolate chips or blueberries which just come as toppings I prefer to have them mixed in the pancake batter instead but this is still super tasty.

Fantastic vibe, amazing food, and top-notch service!

We ordered the Bubbyâ€™s Burger, the Pancake Flight, and the Fried Chicken with coleslaw and a biscuitâ€”everything was absolutely delicious and perfectly portioned.

Yes, the prices are on the higher side, but the quality and generous servings make it well worth it.

Well itâ€™s in a good location with lots of people crossing for sure as they get lots of reviews.
Anyway, service is great, environment is vibrant. We ordered the pancake flight and chicken burger - plating was amazing but pancakes were dense, we wanted a fluffier texture. Chicken burger was good, not blown away though.

Booked a table at Bubbyâ€™s whilst we were in New York as a friend recommended it.The food was absolutely delicious.

I had the pancakes with berry compote and the pancakes were incredibly fluffy. Despite the bigger portion size, it wasnâ€™t too much and not too sweet which was great! My friends enjoyed the breakfast and banana pancakes.

It took a while to be seated despite having booked in advance. However, this was made up by incredibly fast service. Our food came before our drinks! I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever been served so quickly.

The restaurant was very busy so maybe not one for people looking for a quieter breakfast spot.

It is expensive in comparison to a similar meal in the UK but I would say itâ€™s worth a visit. I wish I could get pancakes like this in Scotland â˜ºï¸

Bubbyâ€™s in New York is one of those places you instantly want to come back to after the first bite. We went for breakfast on a weekdayâ€”six of usâ€”and even though it was packed, we got in with a reservation. I highly recommend booking ahead because it does get busy. The vibe is super cozy, relaxed but full of life, and the service was top-notch from the moment we walked in.

The food was amazing. I had the Bubbyâ€™s Special with home fries, bacon, eggs any style, and toast. Everything came out hot and with that homemade flavor that just hits right. My wife had the special breakfast with a pancake topped with blueberry compost, eggs, and bacon, and I have to say: that bacon and blueberry compost were next-levelâ€”truly unforgettable flavors. My brother-in-law ordered the chicken & pancakes and the chicken was crispy but not greasy at all, which was a great surprise. And the pancakes overall were super fluffy, just the way they should be.

A memorable breakfast right in the heart of NY. Definitely one of those spots thatâ€™s worth the hype.

Loved the pancakes, super fluffy and tasty. we were two and we shared the pancake flight (caramelized banana topping), it was more than enough. Coffee was OK.
The line to get a table was HUGE, so we sat outside. It was freezing but we didnâ€™t wanna wait. Overall pretty good!!

Wonderful establishment. Have went out to eat here twice and both times had to circle back for the chicken and pancakes!!! I try so hard to venture out but that crispy chicken and fluffy pancake combo is too goodğŸ¤·ğŸ½â€â™€ï¸ biscuits and butte will always be amazing aswell. Donâ€™t get me started on the house made jam/jelly/spreads. So gooooood! And if you love peanut butter like me I suggest a slice of peanut butter chocolate pie  to-go ğŸ™‚â€â†•ï¸

Nice little spot for breakfest. Unique menu choices but was all flavorful food. It was busy the morning we went, but a spot was available. Very fast food an service. Coffee wasn't the best but the orange juice was absolutely amazing. If you dont mind chicken in the morning, this has to be about the best fried chicken I ever had

Great brunch place, southern inspired pancakes and grits and biscuits. The home fries were spectacular.

Good vibe, long waiting line outside. The wait is worth it.

Bubby's is known for their pancakes so I would recommend ordering those here above all else. I got mine with this blueberry compote that was top notch, they have a few other flavors available as well. The food came out scarily quickly (less than five minutes after being ordered), but it was tasty and fresh, so kudos to them for serving up a breakfast quick enough to make sure you can still make it to your office on time.

If you come here early in the morning you won't have a problem getting a table. But be warned that this place gets busy quick.

The one downside is that Bubby's is pretty pricey spot for a breakfast joint. If you wanna cut down costs, skip the coffee, which I believe came to about $5 a cup.

Abbiamo preso il piatto di pancake classico che ne contiene 3 molto grandi con differenti tipi di frutta e marmellate. Diviso per due persone Ã¨ piÃ¹ che sufficiente. Il negozio ha anche uno store interno molto carino con magliette e tazze a tema del locale. Ovviamente i pancake erano molto buoni, la location molto carina e anche il quartiere. Consigliatissimo.

We went to Bubbyâ€™s on a Thursday around 3 pm. It was busy and mostly filled with chatter from other people, but the food was delicious and so fresh. We got the Turkey BALT with fries, cheese grits, and two Shirley Temples. The sandwich had very fresh ingredients and tasted great. The fries were crunchy and very salty, which my wife and I loved. The cheese grits were good as well. It was my first time trying grits so I canâ€™t give a thorough review on that. I wasnâ€™t a huge fan of the Shirley Temples because they had a flavor that I wasnâ€™t used to in them (it tasted like a strong orange flavor). The staff was very friendly. Definitely recommend!!

Absolutely amazing! Weâ€™ve had several breakfasts around town and this one was the best in my opinion. I had the Crab Eggs Benedict and it was one of the best breakfasts sandwiches Iâ€™ve ever had. No joke it rocked my socks. I was very pleased with the coffee and pancake platter as well. I would absolutely recommend this place for anyone looking for a great breakfast.

We had lunch at Bubbyâ€™s in Tribeca and loved it! We ordered the Chicken and Pancakes and the Turkey Pastrami Reuben with Friesâ€”everything was delicious, cooked perfectly, and full of flavor. If we had to nitpick, weâ€™d say it just needed a pinch more salt, but that didnâ€™t take away from how great the food was. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and service was friendly. Definitely a place weâ€™ll return to the next time weâ€™re in NYC!

Fun rustic eatery in the heart of Soho. Presentation was gorgeous, never had a stack of pancakes so beautiful; coffee plentiful and flowing. Server was friendly and so polite. Average prices for the area, crowded and with a happy vibe, not too noisy. Kid friendly. Bathrooms all the way downstairs. Photo booth for added fun.
Omg the absolute best pancakes and omelette I have EVER had. Atmosphere is a bit loud but the food service is insanely fast. My favorite place we ate in the whole city!

Das Restaurant ist seinen Hype definitiv wert. Obwohl das Restaurant komplett voll war, mussten wir nur kurz auf einen freien Platz warten und wurden schnell bedient. Der Service war freundlich. Das Essen ist lecker, vor allem die Pancakes. Die Portionen sind sehr groÃŸ.

Bubbyâ€™s is a fantastic spot for comfort food in New York. The dishes are absolutely delicious, with generous portions that make every meal satisfying. From their famous pancakes to the savory brunch options, everything is prepared with great care and quality ingredients. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, making it a great place to relax and enjoy a meal.

The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, adding to the overall positive experience. Service is efficient, even when the restaurant is busy. The only downside is the priceâ€”meals can be quite expensive, especially considering the casual dining setting. However, the quality and portion sizes make it worth the cost.

If youâ€™re looking for a great brunch spot in NYC, Bubbyâ€™s is definitely worth a visit!

Assolutamente da provare se passate per ny
Noi siamo andati a fare colazione il mercoledÃ¬
E non abbiamo trovato fila.
I piatti sono super abbondanti e fidatevi che basta una porzione per 2
Il caffÃ¨ americano Ã¨ refill.
Il servizio Ã¨ molto buono
Consiglio vivamenteğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹ğŸ™ğŸ¼

The pancakes were absolutely heavenly â€“ fluffy, rich, and served in a huge portion thatâ€™s hard to beat. There was only a minimal wait, which was great. That said, the service felt a bit rushed and unfriendly, likely due to the high volume of guests. Iâ€™m still waiting on that iced tea I orderedâ€¦ But honestly, those pancakes alone make it worth a visit!

It is alright. Classic breakfast spread with a southern lean.

Good drink selection too.

The sandwich was too oily and the drinks were too sweet. If you like classic American fare, this place might work for you.

Also, $25 for anything (yeah even 3 pancakes) is too much for the quality and taste you get.
